column3: FRENCH
Champion

column2: The person that this title is bestowed upon is considered to be the Champion of the Realm. There is surely no greater honor for mortal men to aspire to.
column3: La personne à qui ce titre est décerné est considérée comme le champion du royaume. Aucun mortel ne saurait espérer titre plus honorable.
column4: Die Person, die diesen Titel erhalten hat, wird als Champion des Reiches angesehen. Es gibt wahrlich keine größere Ehre für Sterbliche.
column6: La persona a la que se le otorga este título es considerada como el Campeón del Reino. No se puede aspirar a un honor mayor para los hombres mortales.

column2: The Master of Arms is responsible for maintaining the production and storage of weapons and armor in the realm. An important and prestigious post.

The "keeper of the flock" is responsible for the realm's herds of sacrificial animals. They manage the shepherds and priests who ensure the animals are raised according to the sacrificial requirements, as dictated by the gods.

The "judges of hellenes" are responsible for maintaining the integrity of athletic competitions. The hellanodikai collectively arrange the various games and events for grand competitions such as the Olympics, and more local tournaments. They are also responsible for judging the outcomes of the games, and are held to an impeccable standard of honesty and justice.

column2:
One of the following must be true:
- The §YMoral Authority§! of your religion must be below §R10§!
- There must be a pagan province in your demesne that is relevant to your culture, in addition to the §YMoral Authority§! of your religion being below §R20§!
- You must be a lunatic and the §YMoral Authority§! of your religion must be below §R40§!

- vous devez estre dément et l'§YAutorité Morale§! de votre religion doit estre inférieure à §R40§!

column2: For quite some time now you have watched the steady decline of the [Root.Religion.GetName] religion. You listen to the [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s as they read from the [Root.Religion.GetScriptureName], and you can't help but wonder if they haven't lost their way. Perhaps the time has come to return to the ways of your [Root.Culture.GetName] ancestors?

column3: Adopter les Coutumes des Temps Anciens

column2: Zoroaster will lead us to enlightenment!
column3: Zoroastre nous mènera à l'illumination !
column4: Zoroaster will lead us to enlightenment!
column6: Zoroaster will lead us to enlightenment!

column2: It's time to visit the elder druids
column3: Il est temps de rendre visite aulx doyens druides
column4: It's time to visit the elder druids
column6: It's time to visit the elder druids

column3: Aulx dieulx d'antan !
Le Valhalla nous attend !
Aulx dieulx d'antan !

column2: God will not lead us astray
column3: Dieu ne nous fera point dévier de notre route
column4: God will not lead us astray
column6: God will not lead us astray

column2: Let us look to the pantheon for guidance
column3: Allons demander conseils et direction au panthéon
column4: Let us look to the pantheon for guidance
column6: Let us look to the pantheon for guidance

column2: Maybe give them one more chance...
column3: Leur donner peult-estre une aultre chance...
column4: Maybe give them one more chance...
column6: Maybe give them one more chance...

column2: You find yourself touring an impoverished province, when word reaches you of a band of ruffians terrorizing local farmers. You remember Zarathustra preaching not only to live righteously but to actively fight evil whenever one can.
column3: Vous visitez une province miséreuse, quand vous avez vent d'une bande de voyous terrorisant les fermiers du coin. Vous vous souvenez de Zoroastre preschant qu'il ne faut point seulement vivre vertueusement, mais aussi combattre activement le mal à chaque fois que l'on peult.
column4: You find yourself touring an impoverished province, when word reaches you of a band of ruffians terrorizing local farmers. You remember Zarathustra preaching not only to live righteously but to actively fight evil whenever one can.
column6: You find yourself touring an impoverished province, when word reaches you of a band of ruffians terrorizing local farmers. You remember Zarathustra preaching not only to live righteously but to actively fight evil whenever one can.

column3: Les traquer vous-mesme

column2: Send a squad of your guards
column3: Envoyer une escouade de vos gardes
column4: Send a squad of your guards
column6: Send a squad of your guards

column2: Let the locals handle it themselves
column3: Laissez les locaulx s'en charger eulx-mesmes
column4: Let the locals handle it themselves
column6: Let the locals handle it themselves

column2: A petition came today from your Muslim vassals to help them rebuild their mosque destroyed in a recent fire. Will you choose the path of tolerance chosen by many of the famous Zoroastrian Shahs of old, or will you ignore those not following the teachings of Zarathustra?
column3: Une pétition est arrivée le jour d'hui de la part de vos vassaulx musulmans demandant de les aider à reconstruire leur mosquée récemment détruite par un incendie. Choisirez-vous la voie de la tolérance, choisie par moults célèbres Shahs Zoroastriens de jadis, ou ignorerez-vous ceulx qui ne suivent point les enseignements de Zoroastre ?
column4: A petition came today from your Muslim vassals to help them rebuild their mosque destroyed in a recent fire. Will you choose the path of tolerance chosen by many of the famous Zoroastrian Shahs of old, or will you ignore those not following the teachings of Zarathustra?
column6: A petition came today from your Muslim vassals to help them rebuild their mosque destroyed in a recent fire. Will you choose the path of tolerance chosen by many of the famous Zoroastrian Shahs of old, or will you ignore those not following the teachings of Zarathustra?

column3: Les aider
Ignorer leur détresse

column2: Today I partake in Sedreh Pushi, an ancient initiation ritual. From this day on I will be a proud member of the Zoroastrian flock
column3: Le jour d'hui, je prends part à Sedreh Pushi, un ancien rite d'initiation. À partir de ce jour, je seroi un fier et féal Zoroastrien
column4: Today I partake in Sedreh Pushi, an ancient initiation ritual. Form this day on I will be a proud member of the Zoroastrian flock
column6: Today I partake in Sedreh Pushi, an ancient initiation ritual. Form this day on I will be a proud member of the Zoroastrian flock

column3: Demander conseil à mon père

column2: Today your child, [From.GetTitledFirstName], partakes in a Sedreh Pushi, an initiation ceremony. [From.GetSheHeCap] will don a shirt (Sudreh), girdle (Kushti), and a covering for the head and begin a new life as a member of the Zoroastrian flock. You can use this opportunity to teach [From.GetHerHim] something about your faith.
column3: Le jour d'hui, votre enfant prend part à un Sedreh Pushi, une cérémonie d'initiation. [From.GetSheHe] revestira une chemise (Sudreh), un corset (Kushti) et un couvre-chef, et débutera une nouvelle vie en tant que membre de la foi Zoroastrienne. Vous pouvez en profiter pour lui apprendre quelque chose sur votre foi.
column4: Today your child partakes in a Sedreh Pushi, an initiation ceremony. [From.GetSheHe] will don a shirt (sudreh), girdle (kusti) and a covering for the head and begin a new life as a member of the Zoroastrian flock. You can use this opportunity to teach [From.GetHerHim] something about your faith.
column6: Today your child partakes in a Sedreh Pushi, an initiation ceremony. [From.GetSheHe] will don a shirt (sudreh), girdle (kusti) and a covering for the head and begin a new life as a member of the Zoroastrian flock. You can use this opportunity to teach [From.GetHerHim] something about your faith.

column3: Parler à [From.GetHerHim] au sujet d'Asha, rectitude

column3: Lui parler de Khshatr, pouvoir divin
column4: Talk to [From.GetHerHim] about Khshatr, divine power

column3: Lui parler au sujet d'Armaiti, dévotion

column3: Je n'ai rien à lui apprendre.

column2: You have decided to rebuild the capital of the ancient Persian empire, albeit in a slightly new location. You commission quarries to deliver large amounts of marble and gather masons from around the realm to build it. How ambitious should this project be?
column3: Vous avez décidé de reconstruire la capitale de l'Ancien Empire Perse, bien que dans un lieu légèrement différent. Vous commandez aulx carrières de grandes quantités de marbre et rassemblez des maçons de tout le royaume pour la construction. À quel point ce projet devroit-il estre ambitieulx ?
column4: You have decided to rebuild the capital of the ancient Persian empire, albeit in a slightly new location. You comission quarries to deliver large amounts of marble and gather masons from around the realm to build it. How ambitious should this project be?
column6: You have decided to rebuild the capital of the ancient Persian empire, albeit in a slightly new location. You comission quarries to deliver large amounts of marble and gather masons from around the realm to build it. How ambitious should this project be?

column2: Make it even greater than it was!
column3: Le rendre encor plus grand qu'il n'estoit !
column4: Make it even greater than it was!
column6: Make it even greater than it was!

column3: Persépolis Reconstruite !

column2: The new city is almost complete. What do you want to work on as a great project to complete the city? You can rebuild the ancient library to further our scholars' work, you can reconstruct the irrigation system to allow you to support more troops, or you can rebuild the Gate of all nations to dazzle the emmisaries from the poeples you subjugated.
column3: Votre nouvelle cité est bientost achevée. Quel seroit le grand projet de votre choilx pour parachever la cité ? Vous pouvez reconstruire l'ancienne bibliothèque pour faire avancer le labeur de nos érudits, vous pouvez reconstruire le système d'irrigation pour vous permettre de sustenir davantage de troupes, ou vous pouvez reconstruire la Porte De Toutes Les Nations pour éblouir les émissaires des peuples que vous avez subjugués.
column4: The new city is almost complete. What do you want to work on as a great project to complete the city? You can rebuild the ancient library to further our scholars' work, you can reconstruct the irrigation system to allow you to support more troops, or you can rebuild the Gate of all nations to dazzle the emmisaries from the poeples you subjugated.
column6: The new city is almost complete. What do you want to work on as a great project to complete the city? You can rebuild the ancient library to further our scholars' work, you can reconstruct the irrigation system to allow you to support more troops, or you can rebuild the Gate of all nations to dazzle the emmisaries from the poeples you subjugated.

column3: Reconstruire la bibliothèque.
Reconstruire le système d'irrigation.

column2: Rebuild the Gate of All Nations.
column3: Reconstruire la Porte de toutes les nations.
column4: Rebuild the Gate of all nations.
column6: Rebuild the Gate of all nations.

column3: Nouvelle Persépolis

column2: The task is complete. New Persepolis has been erected.
column3: La besogne est enfin achevée. La Nouvelle Persépolis est érigée.
column4: The task is complete. New Persepolis has been erected.
column6: The task is complete. New Persepolis has been erected.

column2: Our Empire will never fall again and the world will bathe in our splendor.
column3: Notre Empire ne tombera plus jamais et le monde se pasmera de notre splendeur.
column4: Our Empire will never fall again and the world will bathe in our splendor.
column6: Our Empire will never fall again and the world will bathe in our splendor.

column3: Persépolis est restaurée !

column2: The splendor of Persepolis has been restored many centuries after the destruction of the original in around 330 BC by Alexander the Great. In a new location, New Persepolis seeks to be the beacon of renewed hope at the heart of a new Persian Empire. Already many Persians are seeking to expand the borders of their reborn realm even further.
column3: La splendeur de Persépolis a été rétablie, bien des siècles après la destruction de l'originale autour de 330 av. JC par Alexandre le Grand. Dans un nouveau lieu, La Nouvelle Persépolis a l'ambition d'estre une lueur d'espoir renouvelé au coeur d'un nouvel Empire Perse. Moults Perses quièrent déjà à étendre les frontières de leur royaume renaissant.
column4: The splendor of Persepolis has been restored many centuries after the destruction of the original in around 330 BC by Alexander the Great. In a new location, New Persepolis seeks to be the beacon of renewed hope at the heart of new a Persian Empire. Already many Persians are seeking to expand the borders of their reborn realm even further.
column6: The splendor of Persepolis has been restored many centuries after the destruction of the original in around 330 BC by Alexander the Great. In a new location, New Persepolis seeks to be the beacon of renewed hope at the heart of new a Persian Empire. Already many Persians are seeking to expand the borders of their reborn realm even further.

column3: Inquiétant...
Immortel Une Nouvelle Fois

column2: With the formation of the Persian kingdom, an old terror returns to the world. The Zhayedan (or, as they are more commonly known, Immortals) number 10000 and seek to strike fear into the hearts of the enemies of the Persians. These elite units are comparable to the Greek cataphracts of their time and are equipped with only the finest of equipment and horses. Truly they are a force worthy of the worlds attention.
column3: Avec la formation du Royaume Perse, une vieille terreur reprend le monde. Les Zhayedan (mieulx connus sous le nom d'Immortels), forts de 10 000 hommes, quièrent à inspirer la peur dans le coeur des ennemis des Perses. Ces unités d'élite sont comparables aulx cataphractes grecques en leur temps et sont équipées avec équipement et chevaulx de tout premier ordre. Ils constituent une force réellement digne de l'attention du monde.
column4: With the formation of the Persian kingdom an old terror returns to the world. The Zhayedan (or, as more commonly known, Immortals) number 10000 and seek to strike fear into the hearts of the enemies of the Persians. These elite units are comparable to the Greek cataphracts of their time and are equipped with only the finest of equipment and horses. Truly they are a force worthy of the worlds attention.
column6: With the formation of the Persian kingdom an old terror returns to the world. The Zhayedan (or, as more commonly known, Immortals) number 10000 and seek to strike fear into the hearts of the enemies of the Persians. These elite units are comparable to the Greek cataphracts of their time and are equipped with only the finest of equipment and horses. Truly they are a force worthy of the worlds attention.

column3: Un nouvel Empire Perse

column2: With the reformation of the Persian Empire and the growing of its borders, the Shahanshah has decided that a second force of Zhayedan elites will be required. It would be a grave mistake to underestimate the power of this resurgent Persian Empire, as no one can doubt their legitimacy at this point. But in what direction will their ambitions drive them?
column3: Avec la reformation de l'Empire Perse et l'agrandissement de ses frontières, le Shahanshah a décidé qu'une seconde armée d'élite Zhayedan sera nécessaire. Ce seroit une grave erreur que de sous-estimer cet Empire Perse renaissant, comme personne peult douter de leur force dorénavant. Mais dans quelle direction leur ambition les mènera-t-elle ?
column4: With the reformation of the Persian Empire and the growing of its borders, the Shahanshah has decided that a second force of Zhayedan elites will be required. It would be a grave mistake to underestimate the power of this resurgent Persian Empire, as no one can doubt their legitimacy at this point. But in what direction will their ambitions drive them?
column6: With the reformation of the Persian Empire and the growing of its borders, the Shahanshah has decided that a second force of Zhayedan elites will be required. It would be a grave mistake to underestimate the power of this resurgent Persian Empire, as no one can doubt their legitimacy at this point. But in what direction will their ambitions drive them?

column3: Le Grand Sacrifice

column2: You feel the time is right to make a great sacrifice to one of the divinities of Zoroastrianism. As you begin to plan the event, you realize that you havent even decided on which divinity to sacrifice to. After some deliberation you decide to make a great sacrifice
column3: Vous trouvez que c'est le bon moment de faire un grand sacrifice à l'une des divinités du Zoroastrisme. Alors que vous commencez à préparer l'événement, vous réalisez que vous n'avez toujours point décidé à quelle divinité le sacrifice sera dédié. Après délibération, vous décidez de faire un sacrifice à...
column4: You feel the time is right to make a great sacrifice to one of the divinities of Zoroastrianism. As you begin to plan the event, you realize that you havent even decided on which divinity to sacrifice to. After some deliberation you decide to make a great sacrifice

column2: ... to none of them. It was a silly idea after all.

column3: Le Rituel de Purification

column2: You approach a set of 6 holes about two feet deep for the ritual. The closest three are filled with gomez (consecrated bulls urine, an effective ancient sanitizer). The furthest three are filled with water. There is a holy fire on the far end and you come to the realization that the priests are waiting for you to begin the ritual. As you recite Yasna 49 with the priests and approach the first gomez filled hole.
column3: Vous vous approchez d'un ensemble de 6 trous d'environ 60cm de profondeur pour le rituel. Les trois les plus proches sont remplis de gomez (de l'urine de taureau sanctifiée, un désinfectant ancien mais efficace). Les trois trous les plus éloignés sont remplis d'eau. Il y a un feu sacré tout au bout et vous réalisez que les prestres n'attendent que vous pour commencer le rituel. Tandis que vous récitez le verset 49 du Yasna avec les prestres, vous vous approchez du premier trou rempli de gomez.
column4: You approach a set of 6 holes about two feet deep for the ritual. The closest three are filled with gomez (consecrated bulls urine, an effective ancient sanitizer). The furthest three are filled with water. There is a holy fire on the far end and you come to the realization that the priests are waiting for you to begin the ritual. As you recite Yasna 49 with the priests and approach the first gomez filled hole.
column6: You approach a set of 6 holes about two feet deep for the ritual. The closest three are filled with gomez (consecrated bulls urine, an effective ancient sanitizer). The furthest three are filled with water. There is a holy fire on the far end and you come to the realization that the priests are waiting for you to begin the ritual. As you recite Yasna 49 with the priests and approach the first gomez filled hole.

column2: I praise Thee, O Mazda Ahura, in my hymns and expect enjoying what Thou deemest the best.
column3: Loué sois-Tu, Ô Ahura Mazda, mes hymnes T'accompagnent et ma vie sera telle que Tu auras jugé bon qu'elle soit.
column4: I praise Thee, O Mazda Ahura, in my hymns and expect enjoying what Thou deemest the best.
column6: I praise Thee, O Mazda Ahura, in my hymns and expect enjoying what Thou deemest the best.

column2: Convert all characters to a not Christian and not Muslim religion, based on culture. Does not affect religious heads, so the Caliphate remains. May bring older machines to their knees.
Turn the world pagan by culture. This is mostly for development.

Do you want to turn most of the world pagan? Be warned, nearly every single character will receive an event that converts their religion and that of their personal demesne. This may bring older computers to their knees. This is an unsupported feature primarily for development use!
This is the current expected successor of the religion head.
